description: To fell one Oak within area A1 - TPO 398
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Oak tree is situated within the front garden of 79 Copsewood Way, it contributes to the arboreal character of the Copsewood estate, an Area of Special Local Character and alongside other mature trees provides a gradual transition between the dwellings and Ruislip Woods. It has a moderate amenity value.

The applicant has provided a letter from a Garden Landscape designer which states that the Oak should be removed, however this letter includes no qualifications for the designer and as a result little weight can be given to their opinion. The applicant has also included an email from an Arboricultural Consultant dated 10/10/2021 which states that a possible outcome is that the tree should be removed but they would like to inspect as there may be other possibilities. This additional report does not appear to have been carried out and as a result other options have not been explored. Comparing the photos from November 2021 and April 2023 there appears to have been little change in the
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
